configDefinitions.label: Test Origin
configDefinitions.description: Stage used for testing in preview mode.

labels: ADLS Gen1 (Library: ADLS Transformer-provided libraries for Hadoop 3.2.0)
ADLS Gen2 (Library: ADLS Transformer-provided libraries for Hadoop 3.2.0)
Amazon S3 (Library: AWS Transformer-provided libraries for Hadoop 2.7.7)
Amazon S3 (Library: AWS Transformer-provided libraries for Hadoop 3.2.0)
Azure Event Hubs (Library: Azure Event Hubs)
Delta Lake (Library: Delta Lake Transformer-provided libraries)
Delta Lake (Library: Delta Lake cluster-provided libraries)
Google Cloud Storage (Library: Google Cloud cluster-provided libraries)
MapR Event Store (Library: MapR Event Store libraries)

configDefinitions.name: testOriginStage

configDefinitions.label: Start Event
configDefinitions.description: Stage that should handle pipeline start event.
configDefinitions.name: startEventStage

configDefinitions.label: Stop Event
configDefinitions.description: Stage that should handle pipeline stop event.
configDefinitions.name: stopEventStage

configDefinitions.label: Trigger Interval (millis)
configDefinitions.description: Time interval between generation of batches
configDefinitions.name: triggerInterval

configDefinitions.label: Retry Attempts
configDefinitions.description: Max no of retries. To retry indefinitely, use -1. The wait time between retries starts at 15 seconds and doubles until reaching 5 minutes.
configDefinitions.name: retryAttempts

configDefinitions.label: Enable Ludicrous Mode
configDefinitions.description: Ludicrous mode may significantly improve performance, but metrics will be limited
configDefinitions.name: ludicrousMode

configDefinitions.label: Collect Input Metrics
configDefinitions.description: Collects and displays input metrics. Can result in rereading data unless origins are configured to cache data
configDefinitions.name: ludicrousModeInputCount

configDefinitions.label: Advanced Error Handling
configDefinitions.description: Reports the record that generates an error, when possible. Supported in single-origin pipelines
configDefinitions.name: advancedErrorHandling

configDefinitions.label: Notify on Pipeline State Changes
configDefinitions.description: Notifies via email when pipeline gets to the specified states
configDefinitions.name: notifyOnStates

configDefinitions.label: Email IDs
configDefinitions.description: Email Addresses
configDefinitions.name: emailIDs

configDefinitions.label: Error Record Policy
configDefinitions.description: Determines which variation of the record is sent to error.

labels: Original record as it was generated by the origin.
Record as it was seen by the stage that sent it to error stream.

configDefinitions.name: errorRecordPolicy

labels: Write to Control Hub directly (Library: Basic)

configDefinitions.label: Worker Count
configDefinitions.description: Number of workers. 0 to start as many workers as Kafka partitions for topic.
configDefinitions.name: workerCount

configDefinitions.label: Worker Java Options
configDefinitions.description: Add properties as needed. Changes to default settings are not recommended.
configDefinitions.name: clusterSlaveJavaOpts

configDefinitions.label: Launcher ENV
configDefinitions.description: Sets additional environment variables for the cluster launcher
configDefinitions.name: clusterLauncherEnv

configDefinitions.label: Mesos Dispatcher URL
configDefinitions.description: URL for service which launches Mesos framework
configDefinitions.name: mesosDispatcherURL

configDefinitions.label: Log Level
configDefinitions.description: Log level to use for the launched application
configDefinitions.name: logLevel

configDefinitions.label: Checkpoint Configuration Directory
configDefinitions.description: An SDC resource directory or symbolic link with HDFS/S3 configuration files core-site.xml and hdfs-site.xml
configDefinitions.name: hdfsS3ConfDir

configDefinitions.label: Rate Limit (records / sec)
configDefinitions.description: Maximum number of records per second that should be accepted into the pipeline. Rate is not limited if this is not set, or is set to 0
configDefinitions.name: rateLimit

configDefinitions.label: Max runners
configDefinitions.description: Maximum number of runners that should be created for this pipeline. Use 0 to not impose limit.
configDefinitions.name: maxRunners

configDefinitions.label: Create Failure Snapshot
configDefinitions.description: When selected and the pipeline execution fails with unrecoverable exception, SDC will attempt to createpartial snapshot with records that have not been processed yet.
configDefinitions.name: shouldCreateFailureSnapshot

configDefinitions.label: Runner Idle Time (sec)
configDefinitions.description: When pipeline runners are idle for at least this time, run an empty batch through the runner to process any events or other time-driven functionality. Value -1 will disable this functionality completely.
configDefinitions.name: runnerIdleTIme

configDefinitions.label: Webhooks
configDefinitions.description: Webhooks

configDefinitions.label: Payload
configDefinitions.description: Data that should be included as a part of the Webhook request
configDefinitions.name: payload

configDefinitions.label: Webhook URL
configDefinitions.description: The Webhook HTTP resource URL
configDefinitions.name: webhookUrl

configDefinitions.label: Headers
configDefinitions.description: Headers to include in the request
configDefinitions.name: headers

configDefinitions.label: HTTP Method
configDefinitions.description: HTTP method to send
configDefinitions.name: httpMethod

configDefinitions.label: Content Type
configDefinitions.description: Content-Type header to be sent with the request; used if that header is not already present
configDefinitions.name: contentType
webhookConfigs

configDefinitions.label: Extra Spark Configuration
configDefinitions.description: Additional Spark Configuration to pass to the spark-submit script, the parameters will be passed as --conf <key>=<value>
configDefinitions.name: sparkConfigs

configDefinitions.label: Preprocessing Script
configDefinitions.description: Scala script to run on the driver before starting the pipeline. Can be used to register user defined functions, etc. Use the 'spark' variable to access the Spark session
configDefinitions.name: preprocessScript

configDefinitions.label: Cluster Manager Type
configDefinitions.description: Type of cluster manager used by the Spark cluster
configDefinitions.name: clusterConfig.clusterType

configDefinitions.label: Master URL
configDefinitions.description: Master URL to connect to Spark
configDefinitions.name: clusterConfig.sparkMasterUrl

configDefinitions.label: Deployment Mode
configDefinitions.description: Mode used to launch the Spark driver process
configDefinitions.name: clusterConfig.deployMode

configDefinitions.label: Hadoop User Name
configDefinitions.description: Name of the Hadoop user that StreamSets impersonates
configDefinitions.name: clusterConfig.hadoopUserName

configDefinitions.label: Application Name
configDefinitions.description: Name of the launched Spark application
configDefinitions.name: clusterConfig.sparkAppName

configDefinitions.label: Staging Directory
configDefinitions.description: Staging directory on the remote system for copying StreamSets resources
configDefinitions.name: clusterConfig.stagingDir

configDefinitions.label: Use YARN Kerberos Keytab
configDefinitions.description: Indicates that the Spark application should use a principal and keytab for Kerberos authentication
configDefinitions.name: clusterConfig.useYarnKerberosKeytab

configDefinitions.label: Keytab Source
configDefinitions.description: Source for the Kerberos keytab used to launch the Spark application
configDefinitions.name: clusterConfig.yarnKerberosKeytabSource

configDefinitions.label: YARN Kerberos Keytab Path
configDefinitions.description: Absolute path to the Kerberos keytab used to launch the Spark application for the pipeline
configDefinitions.name: clusterConfig.yarnKerberosKeytab

configDefinitions.label: Keytab Credential Function
configDefinitions.description: Credential function to retrieve the base64 encoded keytab from a credential store.
configDefinitions.name: clusterConfig.yarnKerberosKeytabBase64Bytes

configDefinitions.label: YARN Kerberos Principal
configDefinitions.description: Name of the Kerberos principal used to launch the Spark application for the pipeline.  Must be present in the keytab specified above.
configDefinitions.name: clusterConfig.yarnKerberosPrincipal

configDefinitions.label: Cluster Callback URL
configDefinitions.description: Optional callback URL for the Spark cluster to use to contact this Transformer instance. Use this format: http://<hostname>:<port>
configDefinitions.name: clusterConfig.callbackUrl

configDefinitions.label: Credential Type
configDefinitions.description: Type of credential to use to connect to Databricks

configDefinitions.description: Databricks user name
configDefinitions.name: databricksConfig.username

configDefinitions.label: Token

configDefinitions.label: Terminate Cluster
configDefinitions.description: Terminates the cluster when the pipeline stops
configDefinitions.name: databricksConfig.terminateCluster

configDefinitions.label: Username

configDefinitions.description: Security group ID for the master node

configDefinitions.description: Security group ID for the slave nodes
configDefinitions.name: amazonEMRConfig.slaveSecurityGroup

configDefinitions.label: Region
configDefinitions.description: AWS region
configDefinitions.name: transformerEMRConfig.userRegion

configDefinitions.label: Use Instance Profiles
configDefinitions.description: Use Instance Profiles instead of AWS credentials to connect to AWS
configDefinitions.name: transformerEMRConfig.useIAMRoles

configDefinitions.description: AWS access key ID.
configDefinitions.name: transformerEMRConfig.accessKey

configDefinitions.label: Secret Access Key
configDefinitions.description: AWS secret access key.
configDefinitions.name: transformerEMRConfig.secretKey

configDefinitions.label: S3 Staging URI
configDefinitions.description: S3 URI where Transformer resources are staged for pipeline execution. Use the format: s3://<path>.
configDefinitions.name: transformerEMRConfig.s3StagingUri

configDefinitions.label: Provision a New Cluster
configDefinitions.description: Provisions a new cluster when the pipeline starts
configDefinitions.name: transformerEMRConfig.provisionNewCluster

configDefinitions.label: Terminate Cluster
configDefinitions.description: Terminates the cluster when the pipeline stops
configDefinitions.name: transformerEMRConfig.terminateCluster

configDefinitions.label: Logging Enabled
configDefinitions.description: Copies cluster log files to the specified S3 location. Use to enable continued access to log files.
configDefinitions.name: transformerEMRConfig.loggingEnabled

configDefinitions.label: S3 Log URI
configDefinitions.description: S3 URI to store log files. Use the format: s3://<path>.
configDefinitions.name: transformerEMRConfig.s3LogUri

configDefinitions.label: Service Role
configDefinitions.description: EMR role used by the cluster when provisioning resources and performing other service-level tasks
configDefinitions.name: transformerEMRConfig.serviceRole

configDefinitions.description: EMR role for EC2. Used by EC2 instances within the cluster.

configDefinitions.description: EC2 instances in the cluster. Minimum of 2. Adding instances for multiple partitions can improve performance
configDefinitions.name: transformerEMRConfig.instanceCount

configDefinitions.label: GCS Staging URI
configDefinitions.description: GCS URI where Transformer resources are staged for pipeline execution. Use the format: gs://<path>.
configDefinitions.name: googleCloudConfig.gcsStagingUri

configDefinitions.label: Cluster Prefix
configDefinitions.description: Cluster name is generated by suffixing the pipeline ID to this prefix
configDefinitions.name: googleCloudConfig.clusterPrefix

configDefinitions.label: Image Version
configDefinitions.description: The image version to use for the Dataproc cluster. Example: 1.5-ubuntu18. If not specified, Dataproc default is used
configDefinitions.name: googleCloudConfig.version

stages.label: File
stages.description: Reads data from HDFS-compatible file systems

configDefinitions.label: File Name Pattern
configDefinitions.description: A glob that defines a pattern of file names to process
configDefinitions.name: configBean.fileNamePattern

configDefinitions.label: Exclusion Pattern
configDefinitions.description: A glob that defines a pattern of file names to exclude from processing
configDefinitions.name: configBean.fileNameExcludePattern

configDefinitions.label: Max Files Per Batch
configDefinitions.description: Limits the number of files to be processed in a single batch. Use 0 for unlimited.
configDefinitions.name: configBean.batchNumFileLimit

configDefinitions.label: Schema Mode
configDefinitions.description: Determines the schema to use when reading data
configDefinitions.name: configBean.schemaConfigBean.schemaMode

configDefinitions.label: Schema
configDefinitions.description: Custom schema to use when parsing data
configDefinitions.name: configBean.schemaConfigBean.customSchemaString

configDefinitions.label: Error Handling
configDefinitions.description: Behavior when data does not conform to the schema

labels: Permissive - Creates a record with null values, optionally places original data in a field
Drop Malformed - Drops the record from the pipeline

configDefinitions.name: configBean.schemaConfigBean.parseErrorMode

configDefinitions.label: Original Data Field
configDefinitions.description: String field to contain the original record data when parsing errors occur. Include the field in the custom schema. When not used, the original data for error records is not captured.
configDefinitions.name: configBean.schemaConfigBean.columnNameOfCorruptRecord

configDefinitions.label: Post Processing
configDefinitions.description: Action to take on successfully read files
configDefinitions.name: configBean.postProcessType

configDefinitions.label: Archive Directory
configDefinitions.description: Directory to store successfully read files
configDefinitions.name: configBean.archiveDir

configDefinitions.label: Includes Header
configDefinitions.description: Uses the first row of the first file to name record fields. Skips processing the first row of each file, assuming it is a header row.
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataFormatConfig.csvHeader

configDefinitions.label: Root Tag
configDefinitions.description: Root tag of the XML files
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataFormatConfig.rootTag

configDefinitions.label: Row Tag
configDefinitions.description: Tag used to identify each row
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataFormatConfig.rowTag

configDefinitions.label: Multi-Line JSON
configDefinitions.description: Parse JSON in multi-line mode
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataFormatConfig.multiLineJson

configDefinitions.label: Avro Schema
configDefinitions.description: The Avro schema (in JSON format) to use when reading data
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataFormatConfig.avroSchema

configDefinitions.label: Ignore extension
configDefinitions.description: If enabled, all files (not just those ending in .avro) are read
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataFormatConfig.avroIgnoreExtension

configDefinitions.label: Directory Path
configDefinitions.description: Path to the directory to use
configDefinitions.name: configBean.path

configDefinitions.label: Data Format
configDefinitions.description: Format of the data
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataFormat

configDefinitions.label: Additional Configuration
configDefinitions.description: Additional properties to pass to a Hadoop-compatible file system. These properties take precedence over those defined in HDFS configuration files.
configDefinitions.name: configBean.hdfsProperties

configDefinitions.label: Load Data Only Once
configDefinitions.description: Do not reload data every micro-batch in streaming mode. Has no effect in batch mode. Data will be cached on Spark executors
configDefinitions.name: noReload

configDefinitions.label: Cache Data
configDefinitions.description: If only a small amount of data is read from the source system due to pushdown of operators  from other stages, it might be beneficial to not cache. Caching will cause all data to be read once
configDefinitions.name: cache

configDefinitions.label: Skip Offset Tracking
configDefinitions.description: Do not track offsets between batches. Data will be completely reloaded from the source on  batch.
configDefinitions.name: skipOffsetTracking

stages.name: com_streamsets_pipeline_spark_origin_fs_FileDOrigin

stages.label: Field Renamer
stages.description: Renames one or more existing field names

configDefinitions.label: Rename Type
configDefinitions.description: Controls how fields should be renamed

labels: Find and Replace by Regular Expression

configDefinitions.name: renameType

configDefinitions.label: Case Insensitive
configDefinitions.description: Enables case insensitive matching for field names
configDefinitions.name: caseInsensitive

configDefinitions.label: Field Name
configDefinitions.description: Field to be renamed
configDefinitions.name: field

configDefinitions.label: New Field Name
configDefinitions.description: New field name
configDefinitions.name: replacement

configDefinitions.label: Remove Text
configDefinitions.description: Text to remove from the field name
configDefinitions.name: removeText

configDefinitions.label: Find Pattern
configDefinitions.description: Pattern of the text to replace
configDefinitions.name: searchPattern

configDefinitions.label: Replace Pattern
configDefinitions.description: Pattern to replace the find pattern in matching field names
configDefinitions.name: replacePattern

configDefinitions.label: Target Case
configDefinitions.description: Casing of outgoing fields
configDefinitions.name: caseType

configDefinitions.label: Cache Data
configDefinitions.description: If this process does light-weight processing, due to pushdown of operators from other stages, it might be beneficial to not cache. Caching will cause all data to be read once
configDefinitions.name: cache

stages.name: com_streamsets_pipeline_spark_transform_fieldrenamer_FieldRenamerDTransform

stages.label: Scala
stages.description: Runs Scala code to transform the input DataFrames

configDefinitions.label: Scala Code
configDefinitions.description: Scala code used to transform the DataFrame
configDefinitions.name: code
configDefinitions.defaultValue:
/* 
Use the Seq named inputs to access the input DataFrames. SparkSession is available in a variable named spark.
After performing transformations, save the resulting DataFrame to the pre-defined variable named output. 
Do not declare a new variable - this will cause the script initialization to fail.
 For example, the following code increments the value of the first field by 1, and then saves the result to the output variable:

import spark.implicits._
import scala.collection.mutable.Buffer
output = inputs(0).map(r => r.getLong(0) + 1).toDF()
*/
output = inputs(0)

configDefinitions.label: Skip Empty Batches
configDefinitions.description: Skips running the Scala code when the input is empty
configDefinitions.name: skipEmptyBatches

stages.name: com_streamsets_pipeline_spark_transform_scala_ScalaDTransform

stages.label: File
stages.description: Writes data to a HDFS-compatible file systems

labels: Write new files to new directory
Write new or append to existing files

configDefinitions.label: Text Field
configDefinitions.description: String field that contains the data to be written
configDefinitions.name: configBean.fieldToWrite

configDefinitions.label: Partition by Fields
configDefinitions.description: List of fields to partition the data by. Leave empty to not partition.
configDefinitions.name: configBean.partitionByColumns

configDefinitions.label: Exclude Unrelated SCD Master Records
configDefinitions.description: Excludes records from the write that do not share a partition with any slowly changing dimension changes
configDefinitions.name: configBean.filterUnrelatedScdMasterRecords

configDefinitions.label: Include Header
configDefinitions.description: Includes field names as a header row
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataGeneratorFormatConfig.csvHeader

configDefinitions.label: Root Element
configDefinitions.description: Root element to use for the files. If not set, the destination uses <ROWS>.
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataGeneratorFormatConfig.rootTag

configDefinitions.label: Record Element
configDefinitions.description: Element used to enclose each record. If not set, the destination uses <ROW>.
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataGeneratorFormatConfig.rowTag

configDefinitions.label: Directory Path
configDefinitions.description: Path to the directory to use
configDefinitions.name: configBean.path

configDefinitions.label: Data Format
configDefinitions.description: Format of the data
configDefinitions.name: configBean.dataFormat

configDefinitions.label: Additional Configuration
configDefinitions.description: Additional properties to pass to a Hadoop-compatible file system. These properties take precedence over those defined in HDFS configuration files.
configDefinitions.name: configBean.hdfsProperties

stages.name: com_streamsets_pipeline_spark_destination_fs_FileWriterDDestination

stages.description: Writes pipeline statistics to Control Hub directly without any aggregation
